result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary Brian Rode was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Early Termination from Probation at Agents Discretion After 2.5 years, if costs are paid, all programs/counseling or treatment are completed. 4 Days Credit for Revocation Purposes. 20OU528 Uncharged Referral Dismissed and Read In.

miscConds.notes: The Defendant is to undergo a mental health assessment and comply with any recommended treatment/counseling.  The Defendant is to obtain and maintain full time employment and/or educational programming as recommended to the extent possible per agent.   The Defendant is to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis, unless already provided by 11/1/22. Any contact with DDR per Child Protective Services. Agent to decide if a domestic abuse program is needed.

timeConds.notes: 5 months stayed. Remainder with work release. To begin sentence between 10-1-2022 and 10/15/2022.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
